intro: Seriphidium bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive blue-gray color, while the flowers are yellow with a pale center. Seriphidium bicolor is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
